page.title: 09TOURISM YARMOUTH PIER
page.content: The pier was built in 1875. The wood they used was Douglas Fir but now it is Balau which comes from Malaysia. The length is 187m. The depth of the water at the end of the pier at high tide is 6.2m. At low tide it is 3.1m. It is expected to last another 15o yrs,it was used often until the invention of cars. The pier is 7.75m above the sea bed. Balau is heavier than the water and each plank costs Â£25. In 1984, 105 boats landed 14,825 passengers at the pierhead. 36,060 anglers and promenaders also used the pier.
